org.parboiled.buffers

Class DefaultInputBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.parboiled.buffers.DefaultInputBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InputBuffer
    Deprecated. 
    use CharSequenceInputBuffer instead

    @NotThreadSafe
 @Deprecated
 @WillBeRemoved(version="1.1")
public final class DefaultInputBuffer
extends Object
implements InputBuffer
    Immutable default implementation of an InputBuffer.

                    char[] characters)

                      int end)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: InputBuffer
        Constructs a new String from all character between the given indices. Invalid indices are automatically adjusted to their respective boundary.

        Parameters:

        end - the end index (exclusively)

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition(int index)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: InputBuffer
        Returns the line and column number of the character with the given index encapsulated in a Position object. The very first character has the line number 1 and the column number 1.
        Specified by:
        getPosition in interface InputBuffer
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the character to get the line number of
        Returns:
        the line number

      • getOriginalIndex

        public int getOriginalIndex(int index)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: InputBuffer
        Translates the given index from the scope of this InputBuffer to the scope of the original, underlying char array. The DefaultInputBuffer implementation simply returns the given index, but other implementations like IndentDedentInputBuffer or MutableInputBuffer need to "undo" all compressions and index shiftings performed internally in order to return the underlying index.
        Specified by:
        getOriginalIndex in interface InputBuffer
        Parameters:
        index - the index relative to this InputBuffer
        Returns:
        the index relative to the underlying string or char array

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the string
